alert.note: Alert for Floyd (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 7:03AM EST until February 19 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Levisa Fork at Prestonsburg affecting Floyd County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Levisa Fork at Prestonsburg. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM EST Friday the stage was 25.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest near 30.2 feet this afternoon and then begin to recede. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. The next statement will be issued 6 PM EST.
